title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox are considering a trade for Tigers' ace pitcher Tarik Skubal, a reigning AL Cy Young Award winner.
Skubal, who excelled with a 2.21 ERA and 241 strikeouts in 2025, becomes a free agent after the 2026 season.
Boston has the resources to pursue Skubal, potentially trading players like Jarren Duran or prospects from their farm system.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge blocked the installation of two patron saint statues outside Quincy's new public safety building last month.
PETA offers financial support for statues if Quincy adds a statue of St. Francis of Assisi, the patron saint of animals.
The ACLU filed a lawsuit against the statues' religious nature; the city is appealing with help from Becket Fund law firm.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Patriots QB Drake Maye for overcoming sophomore slump challenges and leading the team to a 7-2 record.
Maye has 2,285 passing yards, 17 touchdowns, and a 74.1% completion rate, ranking third in MVP odds for the season.
Belichick warned of future challenges, citing Washington Commanders' regression as a lesson for the Patriots' continued success.

title: Here’s how many people visited Salem this past Halloween
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: 96,000 visitors came to Salem on Halloween Day, a 7.2% increase from last year, despite rain and a government shutdown.
Salem welcomed 1.1 million unique visitors in October, matching last year's record-setting total, with 1.4 million total visits recorded.
Several government-run buildings were closed due to the shutdown, but local groups maintained events and services for visitors.

title: Whitey Bulger mugshot comes down at Savin Hill restaurant after backlash
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Savin Bar + Kitchen in Dorchester removed Whitey Bulger's mugshot after facing local and national criticism.
Owner Ken Osherow replaced mugshots of mobsters Bulger and Flemmi with historical photos of Boston buildings.
The change followed community backlash highlighting Bulger's violent past and his connection to the restaurant's location.

title: Have you seen snowliage — that wild mix of fall leaves and winter snow?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Snowliage is a natural phenomenon where fall foliage and early snowfall coincide, creating a unique seasonal display.
Photographer Phil Bobrow captured snowliage in Vermont, sharing images on social media highlighting this rare event.
Snowliage occurs when fall leaves remain, but temperatures drop enough for snowfall, blending autumn and winter scenery.

title: Lynn man convicted of killing girlfriend whose body was found in Saugus marsh
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Bruce Maiben, 48, of Lynn, convicted of first-degree murder, was sentenced to life without parole for Sherell Pringle's death.
Sherell Pringle's body was discovered in Rumney Marsh Reservation, Saugus, after being reported missing in December 2021.
Authorities arrested Maiben on additional charges including larceny, evidence tampering, and obstruction before the murder charge.

title: Debt holders take over downtown Boston office building sold below value
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: 99 Bedford St. office building in Boston sold for $19 million, below its assessed value.
Chevron Partners LLC and Capital Hall Partners acquired the building's debt, planning renovations and continued office use.
City of Boston, unsuccessful in bid, aimed to transform the property into housing for downtown revitalization.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten is starting to see his stock rise in Marco Sturm’s system
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten has seen increased ice time, posting four points in his last five games for the Bruins.
Coach Marco Sturm promoted Fraser Minten to a top line with David Pastrnak, boosting offensive effectiveness.
Minten's two-way play and adaptability have secured his place in the Bruins lineup despite earlier game struggles.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in November
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix releases include 'Stranger Things' Season 5 on November 26 and Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' on November 7.
HBO Max features Chris Evans's romcom 'Materialists' on November 7 and Ari Aster's western 'Eddington' on November 14.
Disney+ adds Marvel's 'Fantastic Four: First Steps' on November 5, kicking off holiday-oriented releases across major platforms.
